se.rupy.http
Class Service

java.lang.Object
  se.rupy.http.Service
All Implemented Interfaces:
Chain.Link
Direct Known Subclasses:
Deploy
public abstract class Service
extends java.lang.Object
implements Chain.Link

The service filter is like a servlet which describes its own identifier. You have to be careful how you write your hot-deployable code see the wiki for more information.

Author:
marc

FORCED

public static final int FORCED
The client actively disconnected it's last TCP socket. This will not work correctly if the server is placed behind a proxy.

See Also:

Method Detail

index

public int index()
Specified by:
index in interface Chain.Link

path

public abstract java.lang.String path()
The identifier that should trigger this service. For example "/admin". You can specify a service that should filter multiple identifiers by separating them with a ':' character. For example: if you want to identify a user before multiple services, return "/update:/query" here and set the index to 0 on the identity service and set index to 1 on the update and query filters. Then you use the following code to redirect to the login page for example: 
 public void filter(Event event) throw Event {
     event.reply().header("Location", "/login");
     event.reply().code("302 Found");
     throw event; // stop the chain
 }

Returns:
the path (URI) to the service.

init

public void init()
          throws java.lang.Exception
Initiate service dependencies. This is called when you hot-deploy the application / start the server.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception

done

public void done()
          throws java.lang.Exception
Free service dependencies. This is called when you hot-deploy the application.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception

exit

public void exit(Session session,
                 int type)
          throws java.lang.Exception
If sessions are used and a session invokes a service, that service will then be notified when and how that session was removed with a call to this method.

Parameters:
session -
type -
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

filter

public abstract void filter(Event event)
                     throws Event,
                            java.lang.Exception
The service method, equivalent of HttpServlet.service().

Parameters:
event - the request/response
Throws:
Event - if you want to break the filter chain and disconnect the client
